59: The fitness potential at position $x$ is computed using a localized kernel $K_\rho(x, x')$:
60:

62: V_{\text{fit}}[\rho](x) = -\int_{\mathcal{X}} K_\rho(x, x') \Psi(x') \rho_t(x') \, dx'

68: - $K_\rho(x, x') = Z_\rho^{-1}(x) \exp(-\|x - x'\|^2 / 2\rho^2)$ is the localization kernel

hints.raw_directive:
54: ## 2. Mean-Field Fitness Potential
55: 
56: :::{prf:definition} ρ-Localized Mean-Field Fitness Potential
57: :label: def-rho-localized-fitness
58: 
59: The fitness potential at position $x$ is computed using a localized kernel $K_\rho(x, x')$:
60: 
61: $$
62: V_{\text{fit}}[\rho](x) = -\int_{\mathcal{X}} K_\rho(x, x') \Psi(x') \rho_t(x') \, dx'
63: $$
64: 
65: where:
66: - $\Psi(x')$ is the reward landscape
67: - $\rho_t(x')$ is the spatial walker density
68: - $K_\rho(x, x') = Z_\rho^{-1}(x) \exp(-\|x - x'\|^2 / 2\rho^2)$ is the localization kernel
69: 
70: **Limiting cases**:
71: - $\rho \to \infty$: Global average $V_{\text{fit}} = -\langle \Psi \rangle_{\text{global}}$
